text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with apple jicama slaw that's right
one of my favorite favorite coleslaw
recipes just a great great cold salad
and here's how we do it step one I'm
going to show you my famous hot pink
dressing oh you heard me
hot pink dressing we're going to take
some real mayonnaise don't use fake
mayonnaise we're going to take some
pineapple juice a good amount of hot
sauce I'm using sriracha you could use
any hot sauce the hotter the better a
little bit of sugar and that's it the
thing I love about my hot pink dressing
very few ingredients yet it's super
delicious super flavorful super
versatile alright whip that up till it's
nice and smooth you can see how
beautiful light and fluffy that is just
a great dressing alright we're going to
set that aside and we're going to get on
to the vegetable prep which is going to
be one Fuji apple some green cabbage and
this would I call jicama although I
believe the proper pronunciation is
jekima
but anyway I call it jicama the label
said a Mexican potato which is just a
horrible description tastes nothing like
a potato texture similar it has a very
mild sweet flavor and crunchy texture
fantastic in coleslaw all right so I'm
going to use 1/2 this small cabbage so
cut it in half you know how to take the
core out well in case you don't here's
how you do it put your knife in at an
angle and that core will come right out
see that so easy all right I'm going to
cut that in half and then each half I'm
going to slice into like quarter-inch
ribbons very very easy a sharp knife
helps alright we're going to dump that
in a large mixing bowl next up is the
jicama which I'm going to cut in half be
careful super hard do not get your
fingers anywhere near that blade once
it's cut in half I'm going to turn it on
its side and I'm going to shave off the
peel all right I like to use a knife
here it's a really thick waxy peel I
don't have too much luck with a potato
peeler so just do it like that once it's
peeled I'm going to grab my vegetable
slicer my mandolin with the sort of
julienne large julienne blade alright I
want this roughly the same width as my
cabbage strips so about a quarter inch
of course you can use the guard to
protect your fingers because as I always
say fingertips way more expensive than
vegetables so be careful
so I grated half of that jicama I toss
that in there I'm going to grate the
entire Apple on the same setting alright
so a nice thick julienne matchsticks if
you will toss that in here I'm just
playing with it for no apparent reason
there's not even any dressing in it I
don't know why I'm doing that I'm going
to dump in the dressing and we're going
to mix this twice ok so pour in the
dressing toss it until combined and then
we're going to let it sit for about five
minutes this is not one of those
coleslaw is that you want to dress like
the night before you want to do this
relatively close to when you're going to
serve all right should be fresh crispy
salad not a soggy wet thing okay so toss
it I'm going to let it sit for five
minutes
then I'm going to toss it again but
before I do I'm going to add some fresh
cilantro optional but highly recommended
all right take off your wedding ring if
you're going to toss with your fingers
wash your hands of course so once that's
tossed the second time it's ready to
serve now you can do that an hour ahead
if you want and then toss it again but I
like to do it right before and that's
pretty beautiful
come on how beautiful is that but we're
not done I'm going to take these corn
nuts I love those things so addictive
I'm going to take corn nuts and I'm
going to crush those and use that for
like a crunchy topping a little extra
color another layer of textural
excitement to this already texturally
thrilling salad and then it was time to
taste look at that that is a beautiful
coleslaw once the last time you got
excited about a vegetable slaw like
never alright that's about to change so
good sweet crunchy fresh a little bit
spicy cool crisp just so good so anyway
I hope you give this a try this one goes
out to all my vegetarian fans where my
veggie murderers
go to food wishes calm for all the
ingredient amounts and as always enjoy
